briefdescription.para: the range of tiles which are covered by this object
decide which terrains this object can be on this function should be true if given a valid position for the object
specifies content to be drawn
annexes and grouped units
texture for drawing outline
is the object a floating outline it is only an indicator of where a building will be built, but not yet started building and does not affect any collisions
returns true if this object has been placed.

detaileddescription.para: this indicates that the object has a position and exists on the map, floating buildings are not considered placed as they are only an indicator for where something can begin construction

briefdescription.para: should this object be tested for collisions, which decides whether another object is allowed to overlap the location of this object.

detaileddescription.para: arrows and decaying objects will return false

briefdescription.para: draws outline of this terrain space in current position
changes the placement state of this object keeping the existing position.

detaileddescription.para: this is useful for upgrading a floating building to a placed state

briefdescription.para: binds the TerrainObject to a certain TerrainChunk.

parameterdescription.para: the terrain where the object will be placed onto.
should be floating, placed or placed_no_collision

simplesect.para: true when the object was placed, false when it did not fit at pos.

briefdescription.para: moves the object returns false if object cannot be moved here
remove this TerrainObject from the terrain chunks.
sets all the ground below the object to a terrain id.

parameterdescription.para: the terrain id to which the ground is set
amount of additional space arround the building

briefdescription.para: appends new annex location for this object

detaileddescription.para: this does not replace any existing annex

briefdescription.para: Returns the parent terrain object, if null the object has no parent which is the case for most objects.

detaileddescription.para: objects with a parent are owned by that object and to be placed on the map the parent must also be placed

briefdescription.para: Returns a list of child objects, this is the inverse of the get_parent() function.

xrefdescription.para: this does not perform optimally and is likely to change
a better performing way of doing this for example accept a lambda to use for each element or maintain a duplicate class field for raw pointers

briefdescription.para: comparison for TerrainObjects.

detaileddescription.para: sorting for vertical placement. by using this order algorithm, the overlapping order is optimal so the objects can be drawn in correct order.

briefdescription.para: returns the range of tiles covered if the object was in the given pos

parameterdescription.para: the position to find a range for

briefdescription.para: how far is a point from the edge of this object
get a position on the edge of this object
does this space contain a given point
would this intersect with another object if it were positioned at the given point
the shortest line that can be placed across the objects center
placement function which does not check passibility used only when passibilty is already checked otherwise the place function should be used this does not modify the units placement state

Base class for map location types which include square tile aligned positions and radial positions This enables two inheriting classes SquareObject and RadialObject to specify different areas of the map.

detaileddescription.para: All TerrainObjects are owned by a Unit, to construct TerrainObjects, use the make_location function on any Unit

This class allows intersection testing between two TerrainObjects to cover all cases of intersection (water, land or flying objects) the units lambda function is used which takes a tile and returns a bool value of whether that tile can be passed by this
The name of this class is likely to change to TerrainBase or TerrainSpace
